snippet: The spill, which affected 200 miles of the Longjiang River in southern China, was caused by two companies that accidentally released tons of cadmium.
abstract: Seven officials in southern China are dismissed from their jobs in the wake of the accidental release of tons of cadmium into the Longjiang River; spill fouled drinking water supplies for tens of millions of people and officials say the safe dilution of the toxic heavy metal could take another month.
lead_paragraph: The spill, which affected 200 miles of the Longjiang River in southern China, was caused by two companies that accidentally released tons of cadmium.

headline.seo: China Fires Officials for Not Reporting Toxic Spill
